Text.Value: You can tell the Stone Lord I won't be causing no more trouble. If my ma was alive, I'd swear on her life!
Look, I ain't got much in the way of thanks but the stiff below has some fancy doodahs - you're welcome to 'em.
You and me both. That's what I get for filching a baldy - the nutcase made me dig my own grave!

EditorData.NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

Text.Value: What were you doing down there?
A high and mighty type? Ahem, 'oh, I've learned my ways and will never steal again.' Happy?
Lady Lucky didn't help you - I did.
The best thanks are paid in coin.
Sightseeing. What do you think? I filched the wrong baldy and got myself buried for the trouble.

EditorData.NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end. (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

Text.Value: 'Stone Lord' he calls himself. More like Stone Shite.
Sounds like apt punishment for thievery.
Mate, if I'd had coin I wouldn't have been robbing it in the first place, now would I?
'Stone Shite'? I'll tell him you said that.
I'll prove it! The Stone Shi - Lord buried me with my haul. Take it all, and tell him I'm sorry!
I've heard of him - he's a new gang boss, right?
The gang boss that's been all up in Nine-Fingers' territory. He's brutal - steer clear.
I got greedy, all right? But I won't make the same mistake twice - thieves' honour.
Who is this Stone Lord?
Huh. Plant a bad man in the soil, and out grows a better one. Perhaps Jaheira has taught me something.
You idiot, learn the signs of a dangerous mark!
Aye, now I'll return the favour. You see an angry looking baldy? Don't filch him. I did and it got me a stiff for a bunk-mate.

EditorData.NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end. (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

Text.Value: Gods, it's you! I'm sorry for thieving ya Mr Stone Lord, sir. I'll never do it again, don't hurt me!
*Cough.* Thought I was done for. Lady Luck bless ya.

EditorData.NodeContext: hacking, spluttering, wipping and dusting himself off after being buried alive. Not looking at player.

Text.Value: The stiff below has some doodahs. Normally I'd say finders keepers, but I'll generously leave 'em to you as thanks.
You - you know baldy? I mean, I shouldn't have filched him. I'll - I'll never do it again!
I'm surprised you're still breathing.
Oh gods, it's you. I'm so sorry mr Stone Lord sir - I'll never steal again, I swear it!

EditorData.NodeContext: absolutely shitting it - thinks he might get buried again

Text.Value: Everything I've got is buried with the stiff. Take it all - as a thank you for, uh, saving me. Just don't hurt me, mr Stone Lord sir!

EditorData.NodeContext: panicked - would say/do anything to make sure he doesn't get put back in the ground again

Text.Value: The very one - and my idiot self didn't realise 'til I was fingers-deep in his pockets. Won't be making that mistake again.
Wait 'til the boys hear where I've been. No one but you is gonna believe me.
It is well that Minsc had no hamster for your sticky fingers to find. When Boo buries a villain, they stay that way.

Synopsis: Gothric Rillyn has been buried underground by Minsc after he tried to rob him. Player can hear muffled yelling from the grave and try to dig him out. This dialogue opens with Gothric having just pulled himself out of the hole (we don't see this in cinematic) and is now dusting himself down.
